name: Screenbeard
message: You're absolutely right. Going into it without any pre-conceived ideas is probably the best way to learn it. I guess the problem is, there's pressure to market it as "like" something, or to explain it in real-world terms, when there really isn't anything like it at all. You or I can pick it up and run with it, but how do you teach something completely new to people who learn by pinning concepts to things they know well?
